channel.title: Talks By Mark E. Petersen
channel.description: General Conference talks by Mark E. Petersen.

image.title: General Conference talks by Mark E. Petersen.

item.title: Warnings from the Past
item.description: Three great civilizations have occupied the Western Hemisphere. Two have passed into oblivion.

item.title: Honesty, a Principle of Salvation
item.description: One of the Articles of Faith of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints includes the expression, “We believe in being honest.” (.)

item.title: A People of Sound Judgment
item.description: It was most fitting, my brethren and sisters, that we sing the glorious hymn that we have just sung [“We Thank Thee, O God, for a Prophet”], because we have just listened to the voice of the prophet of God.

item.title: Another Prophet Now Has Come!
item.description: An event of great importance to the entire Christian world has taken place during this conference of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Salvation Comes through the Church
item.description: When the Savior established his church during his mortal ministry, and as it was further developed by the twelve apostles of that day, one important fact became conspicuously clear, which is: that salvation comes through the Church.

item.title: “What Will a Man Give?”
item.description: The Savior taught with many parables, and they are well known. But he also taught with pertinent and piercing questions. One of them was this: “… what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?” (.)

item.title: The People Say “Amen”
item.description: During this conference we have formally installed a new president of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. It was a momentous occasion.

item.title: Eternal Togetherness
item.description: I would like at this time to express the deep appreciation I feel, and I am sure all of you feel, for the magnificent leadership of President Kimball. He thrills us; he thrills me and I am sure he thrills you. He is a mighty man of God, and yet he is

item.title: The Sabbath Day
item.description: One of the first things the Lord taught the Prophet Joseph Smith at the beginning of this dispensation was that he must take the divine commandments seriously.

item.title: “Hear Ye Him!”
item.description: I cannot refrain, my brothers and sisters, from expressing deep gratitude to the marvelous musicians who have sung and played for us during this conference. I have been thrilled with the music as I seldom have been in a conference, and just for one I

item.title: The Message of Elijah
item.description: We Latter-day Saints have a divine message for the world. It is that God has spoken again from the heavens in these last days and has given us once more the gospel of the Lord Jesus Christ in a great new revelation of his will.

item.title: The Savor of Men
item.description: I would like to talk with you about Abraham Lincoln, man of God.

item.title: Do Unto Others …
item.description: Elder Monson and I have traveled a good many miles together, over a good many years. Elder Monson and I and Louis Jacobsen likewise traveled together for a long time over the years of our lives. And I hope, with Brother Monson’s permission, I may now

item.title: It Was a Miracle!
item.description: I stand here today to testify to the divine calling of the Prophet Joseph Smith and to declare my faith in the miracle by which the Book of Mormon was translated and published.

item.title: “Evidence of Things Not Seen”
item.description: Some people continue to challenge Book of Mormon. Not only do they attack the authenticity of that sacred volume, but they question our right to have scriptures other than the Bible.

item.title: The Last Words of Moroni
item.description: Last week we passed one of the most significant anniversaries recognized by our Church. It marked the visitations of the Angel Moroni to the Prophet Joseph Smith, preliminary to the restoration of the gospel of Jesus Christ in our day. (.)

item.title: Signs of the True Church
item.description: The spring of the year is a most welcome season. It is then that all life seems to renew itself, when the promise of the future appears brightest and hope rises to its zenith. Indeed it is a time of reawakened courage and confidence.

item.title: O America, America
item.description: After one of his journeys in Palestine, Jesus came to his own city and taught in the synagogue on the Sabbath day.

item.title: Where Do We Stand?
item.description: This anniversary of the Church is of great importance to the Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Adam, the Archangel
item.description: On a warm summer day I visited the land of Adam-ondi-Ahman in the state of Missouri. I had looked forward to this visit with keen anticipation, for I had never been there before.

item.title: Blessings in Self-Reliance
item.description: My wife was the daughter of a sea captain who lost a ship at sea. As the survivors drifted in lifeboats hour after hour before they were picked up, they all sang, “Jesus, Savior, Pilot Me.” ( no. 121.)

item.title: Follow the Prophets
item.description: As Brother Featherstone mentioned in his prayer, one of the favorite hymns of the Latter-day Saints actually is a prayer for the President of the Church. It is sung by congregations throughout the world with the beautiful theme mentioned by Brother F

item.title: “Even As I Am”
item.description: Yes, we know who He is, this Christ of whom we speak. And we know that He lives!

item.title: “We Believe in Being Honest”
item.description: Basic to our religion are the Articles of Faith given us by the Prophet Joseph Smith.

item.title: Believers and Doers
item.description: We are thankful for this, another opportunity to bear testimony of the Lord Jesus Christ and of His divine Sonship, for truly He is the well-beloved and Only Begotten Son of our Heavenly Father.

item.title: Creator and Savior
item.description: Springtime always brings Easter, and Easter turns our minds to Jesus Christ, our Savior.

item.title: The Angel Moroni Came!
item.description: About two weeks ago we noted one of the most important anniversaries in our Church history.
